title: Plural tags and counts for i18next
body:
It turns out that i18next decided to build their own plural rules instead of relying on CLDR like nearly everybody else. Because of that plural tags differ for some language in translate-toolkit and the original code.

See https://github.com/WeblateOrg/weblate/issues/8625

Somebody needs to go through https://github.com/i18next/i18next/blob/a334583a7752bf83a62da10fae035af53641784b/src/PluralResolver.js#L5-L39, and figure out differences compared to CLDR. Once this is done, the exceptions need to be handled in the i18next storage.

title: json: Allow overwriting integer with a string
body: Sometimes number is intended to be a string in the JSON file and it is reasonable to translate it.

its not entirely clear to me whether this is an issue with the testsuite, with translate or with gettext. please help.

title: rc2po won't generate pot file if a comment is encountered
body:
If comments are present in the rc file, rc2po processes the file without an error message but fails to create a pot file. This used to work but stopped sometime early 2021. Removing all comments is the current workaround. Note that comments in a STRINGTABLE are ok due to commit 607d046228219d347fe533c2665ceeb58907caa2. However it should work no matter where the comment is.

example:
```
//MENUITEM "Commented.", ID_COMMENTED
MENUITEM "Copied", ID_COPIED
// This comment will also break rc2po
MENUITEM "Delete", ID_DELETE   

```

title: rc file parser doesn't treat all whitespace similarly
body:
e.g. res.rc

```
IDD_DIALOG DIALOG 0, 0, 340, 180
CAPTION "Caption"
BEGIN
    LTEXT           "Right",IDC_STATIC_HEADER,7,0,258,8,NOT WS_GROUP
    LTEXT           "Wrong",IDC_STATIC_HEADER
                    ,7,0,258,8,NOT WS_GROUP
END
```

running `rc2po res.rc res.po`, produces res.po containing:

```
#: DIALOG.IDD_DIALOG.CAPTION
msgid "Caption"
msgstr ""

#: DIALOG.IDD_DIALOG.LTEXT.IDC_STATIC_HEADER
msgid "Right"
msgstr ""

#: DIALOG.IDD_DIALOG.LTEXT.[%27IDC_STATIC_HEADER%27]
msgid "Wrong"
msgstr ""
```

title: Comments break Fluent (FTL) serialization
body:
The current implementation seems to completely choke on any [free-standing Fluent comments](https://projectfluent.org/fluent/guide/comments.html) during serialization. Weblate imports the FTL seemingly fine, but exporting in any way (repository commits or file downloads) results in a fatal error:

- `TypeError - 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable`
- Traced to `"/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/stream.py", line 13, in get return self.string[offset]`

Detailed error log:

<details>

```
Internal Server Error: /download/rustfest-cfp/cfp-form/en/

TypeError at /download/rustfest-cfp/cfp-form/en/
'NoneType' object is not subscriptable

Request Method: GET
Request URL: http://weblate.rustfest.global/download/rustfest-cfp/cfp-form/en/
Django Version: 3.2.7
Python Executable: /home/weblate/weblate-env/bin/uwsgi
Python Version: 3.8.10
Python Path: ['/', '/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/git/ext/gitdb', '.', '', '/usr/lib/python38.zip', '/usr/lib/python3.8', '/usr/lib/python3.8/lib-dynload', '/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages', '/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/gitdb/ext/smmap']
Server time: Wed, 08 Sep 2021 17:59:26 +0000

 'weblate.utils',
 'weblate.vcs',
 'weblate.wladmin',
 'weblate.metrics',
 'weblate',
 'weblate.gitexport',
 'django.contrib.auth',
 'django.contrib.contenttypes',
 'django.contrib.sessions',
 'django.contrib.messages',
 'django.contrib.staticfiles',
 'django.contrib.admin.apps.SimpleAdminConfig',
 'django.contrib.admindocs',
 'django.contrib.sitemaps',
 'django.contrib.humanize',
 'social_django',
 'crispy_forms',
 'compressor',
 'rest_framework',
 'rest_framework.authtoken',
 'django_filters']
Installed Middleware:
['weblate.middleware.RedirectMiddleware',
 'weblate.middleware.ProxyMiddleware',
 'django.middleware.security.SecurityMiddleware',
 'django.contrib.sessions.middleware.SessionMiddleware',
 'django.middleware.csrf.CsrfViewMiddleware',

 'django.middleware.clickjacking.XFrameOptionsMiddleware',

 'weblate.api.middleware.ThrottlingMiddleware',

 'weblate.wladmin.middleware.ManageMiddleware']


Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 47, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 181, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/trans/views/files.py", line 136, in download_translation
    return download_translation_file(request, obj, **kwargs)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/utils/decorators.py", line 130, in _wrapped_view
    response = view_func(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/utils/views.py", line 312, in download_translation_file
    translation.commit_pending("download", None)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/contextlib.py", line 75, in inner
    return func(*args, **kwds)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/trans/models/translation.py", line 559, in commit_pending
    self.update_units(units, store, author_name, author.id)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/trans/models/translation.py", line 733, in update_units
    store.save()
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/formats/ttkit.py", line 304, in save
    self.save_atomic(self.storefile, self.save_content)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/formats/base.py", line 314, in save_atomic
    callback(temp)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/weblate/formats/ttkit.py", line 300, in save_content
    self.store.serialize(handle)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/translate/storage/fluent.py", line 194, in serialize
    body = [unit.to_entry() for unit in self.units]
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/translate/storage/fluent.py", line 194, in <listcomp>
    body = [unit.to_entry() for unit in self.units]
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/translate/storage/fluent.py", line 151, in to_entry
    value = fp.maybe_get_pattern(FluentParserStream(self.source))
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/parser.py", line 343, in maybe_get_pattern
    ps.peek_blank_inline()
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/stream.py", line 70, in peek_blank_inline
    while self.current_peek == ' ':
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/stream.py", line 34, in current_peek
    return self.char_at(self.index + self.peek_offset)
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/stream.py", line 22, in char_at
    if self.get(offset) == '\r' \
  File "/home/weblate/weblate-env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fluent/syntax/stream.py", line 13, in get
    return self.string[offset]

Exception Type: TypeError at /download/rustfest-cfp/cfp-form/en/
Exception Value: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

</details>

[Here](https://github.com/RustFestEU/cfp/blob/709e4d5bdd14c2f33b9d1a08401b5bc901ae0fb2/locales/en/cfp.ftl) is the imported original FTL file that should reproduce the issue.

I am not a Python coder but I managed to trace this to handling of various comment nodes (`ast.Resource|Group|Comment`) which are comments used to partition the resource file, as opposed to being descriptions attached to a particular message. I managed to patch `translate/storage/Fluent.ftl` with a fix locally which should help fixing this properly: [The changes](https://gist.github.com/flaki/326736cc8d7b5930e7fed2fcaf6b3896#file-translate_storage_fluent-py-L143-L174) require producing the correct AST nodes for the comment sections so the serialization succeeds.

This is purely a syntactical-fix, without taking into account the semantics of these comments, but it works well for well-formed files at least when importing and exporting the comments.

title: poterminology always generates FutureWarning about a regexp containing a nested set
body:
Whenever I run poterminology on *any* PO file, using a command like this

    poterminology test.po

it generates a FutureWarning:

    /usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/translate/tools/poterminology.py:88:
    FutureWarning: Possible nested set at position 6
      self.xmlelpat = re.compile(r"<(?:![[-]|[/?]?[A-Za-z_:])[^>]*>")

The command currently succeeds, but I guess that in future versions of Python, it may not.

Tested using poterminology version 3.3.2 and Python 3.8.

title: XWiki Page Properties format does not handle correctly source edition
body:
As explained in https://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWiki%20Translations%20Formats/#HFileFormat: 
>  source translation files need to contain a XWiki.TranslationDocumentClass xobject as documented in Localization Extension

Right now editing the source file translation has the effect to remove this special class. You can see the result when using this format on Weblate here: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-activitypub/pull/22/files#diff-0134e6af64b31dc0fc0e04d39cece9438a0cc36b411b5f474aee2f90ff5e162cL113

title: pocount infinite loop
body:
hi,

here is a code creating an infine loop with pocount:
```
#| identified as a comment
#|raise an infinite loop bug!
msgid "text"
msgstr "texte"
```

I feel like to happen somewhere there: https://github.com/translate/translate/blob/master/translate/storage/poparser.py#L93
and https://github.com/translate/translate/blob/master/translate/storage/poparser.py#L123

I understand the translate toolkit is able to detect changes of msgid?
changing the test looks breaks previous msgid detection.
but I am unsure to understand the usecase here.
We normally have the fuzzy strings to handle previous values, why would a translator keep the previous string id as a comment?

```
#. type: verbatim
#: darktable.pod:12
#, no-wrap
#| msgid ""
#|"    -d {all,cache,camctl,camsupport,control,dev,fswatch,imageio,input,\n"
#|"        ioporder,lighttable,lua,masks,memory,nan,opencl,params,perf,\n"
#|"        pwstorage,print,signal,sql,undo}\n"
#| "    --disable-opencl\n"
#| "    --library <library file>\n"
#| "    --datadir <data directory>\n"
#| "    --moduledir <module directory>\n"
#| "    --tmpdir <tmp directory>\n"
#| "    --configdir <user config directory>\n"
#| "    --cachedir <user cache directory>\n"
#| "    --localedir <locale directory>\n"
#| "    --luacmd <lua command>\n"
#| "    --conf <key>=<value>\n"
#| "    --noiseprofiles <noiseprofiles json file>\n"
#| "    --help\n"
#| "    --version\n"
#| "\n"
msgid ""
"    --cachedir <user cache directory>\n"
"    --conf <key>=<value>\n"
"    --configdir <user config directory>\n"
"    -d {all,cache,camctl,camsupport,control,dev,fswatch,imageio,input,\n"
"        ioporder,lighttable,lua,masks,memory,nan,opencl,params,perf,\n"
"        pwstorage,print,signal,sql,undo}\n"
"    --datadir <data directory>\n"
"    --disable-opencl\n"
"    -h, --help\n"
"    --library <library file>\n"
"    --localedir <locale directory>\n"
"    --luacmd <lua command>\n"
"    --moduledir <module directory>\n"
"    --noiseprofiles <noiseprofiles json file>\n"
"    -t <num openmp threads>\n"
"    --tmpdir <tmp directory>\n"
"    --version\n"
"\n"
msgstr ""
"    --cachedir <répertoire du cache de l'utilisateur>\n"
"    --conf <clef>=<valeur>\n"
"    --configdir <répertoire de configuration de l'utilisateur>\n"
"    -d {all,cache,camctl,camsupport,control,dev,fswatch,imageio,input,\n"
"        ioporder,lighttable,lua,masks,memory,nan,opencl,params,perf,\n"
"        pwstorage,print,signal,sql,undo}\n"
"    --datadir <répertoire des données>\n"
"    --disable-opencl\n"
"    -h, --help\n"
"    --library <fichier de bibliothèque>\n"
"    --localedir <répertoire local>\n"
"    --luacmd <commande Lua>\n"
"    --moduledir <répertoire des modules>\n"
"    --noiseprofiles <fichier json des profils de bruit>\n"
"    -t <nombre de fils d'exécution OpenMp>\n"
"    --tmpdir <répertoire temporaire>\n"
"    --version\n"
"\n"
```

title: Broken readthedocs.org integration
body:
The readthedocs.org integration lacks some permissions, and I'm unable to fix that. It might need something on the organization level, what I can't control.

* It fails to set build status, what would be really handy on pull request builds (it publishes pull request docs to a temporary URL)
* The webhook sync from the rtd.org fails (I hoped that this might address the issue above)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/212189/103479355-7581b000-4dcd-11eb-9a9c-52a10c419c7a.png)

Looking at Weblate, we have Read the Docs Community (readthedocs.org) approved in Third-party access. That should be on 
https://github.com/organizations/translate/settings/oauth_application_policy for translate org. Can somebody from @translate/house check this?

title: --charset ignored for rc files
body:
input file, encoded as UTF-8 no BOM:
```
#pragma code_page(65001)

STRINGTABLE
BEGIN
    IDS_COPIED              "✔ Copied"
END
```

command: `rc2po --charset=utf-8 -i test.rc -o test.pot -P`

output file (relevant part only, UTF-8 no BOM):
```
#: STRINGTABLE.IDS_COPIED
msgid "âœ” Copied"
msgstr ""
```

title: sub2po - Can't find headers file
body:
On a fresh install of python 3.8 in a new virtualenv, I get the following error:

```
(ttk) C:\dev\translate-toolkit>sub2po -P "C:\dev\translate-toolkit\DA Launch Trailer.ass" "C:\dev\translate-toolkit\trailer.pot"
processing 1 files...
Failed to read file 'C:\Users\Sim\Envs\ttk\lib\site-packages\data\headers\ass': No such file or directory
sub2po: WARNING: Error processing: input C:\dev\translate-toolkit\DA Launch Trailer.ass, output C:\dev\translate-toolkit\trailer.pot, template None: FileNotFoundError(2, 'No such file or directory')
[###########################################] 100%
```

I suspect there is a package required that I have not installed and did not see in the install docs, but maybe it is something else?

I have installed aeidon; here is my package list:

```
(ttk) C:\dev\translate-toolkit>pip list
Package           Version
----------------- ---------
aeidon            1.7.0
ass               0.5.1
certifi           2020.6.20
chardet           3.0.4
idna              2.10
iniparse          0.5
inotify           0.2.10
lxml              4.6.1
nose              1.3.7
pip               20.2.4
requests          2.24.0
setuptools        50.3.2
six               1.15.0
srt               3.4.1
subtitle          2.1
translate-toolkit 3.1.1
urllib3           1.25.11
wheel             0.35.1
```

FYI, [I had the same error](https://github.com/WeblateOrg/weblate/issues/4732) in a linux environment when trying to do this via Weblate.

title: setup.py fails with py2exe
body:
I've got this error from setup.py:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 526, in <module>
    standardsetup("translate-toolkit", translateversion)
  File "setup.py", line 486, in standardsetup
    translatebashscripts)
  File "setup.py", line 490, in dosetup
    from setuptools import setup

    return lookup(item)
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\setuptools\monkey.py", line 61, in get_unpatched_class

AssertionError: distutils has already been patched by <class py2exe.Distribution at 0x047BBF48>
```

title: po2php fills translation files with source values rather than translations
body:
Version 2.4.0

Hello, 

I have two translation folders (en and fr) with files following this structure:
```
<?php return [
	'key'    => 'value',
	'key2'       => 'value2',
];
```
When I do 

> php2po -P lang/en pot/ 

and 

> php2po -t lang/en lang/fr po-fr/

I get my pot and my po files where the English values are correctly translated to French.

However, when I do 

> po2php - t lang/en po-fr/ lang/fr 
it replaces the french values in the french translation files with the english source values.

Any idea what I'm doing wrong?

title: TZ changes will cause tests to fail
body:
`translate/storage/test_poheader.py` tests various timezone offsets as part of testing the header of the PO files. One such test at line 125 is

```
        os.environ['TZ'] = 'Africa/Windhoek'
        time.tzset()
        assert time.timezone == -3600
```
Namibia changes its TZ definitions in 2018 and so this test fails when run after 2018-04-01

```
tzdata
Release 2017c - 2017-10-20 14:49:34 -0700

  Changes to future time stamps

    Namibia will switch from +01 with DST to +02 all year on
    2017-09-03 at 02:00.  This affects UT offsets starting 2018-04-01
    at 02:00.  (Thanks to Steffen Thorsen.)
```
Picking some other timezone that isn't changing would be one solution. Simply dropping these lines from the test is probably also OK since they're not testing anything beyond what remains.

We discovered this test failure because all package builds (which includes running the tests) are routinely run 398 days into the future to spot packages that are including unwanted information like compilation dates in their output. See [build/test log](https://tests.reproducible-builds.org/debian/logs/buster/amd64/translate-toolkit_2.2.5-1.build2.log.gz), [variations used](https://tests.reproducible-builds.org/debian/index_variations.html), [more on reproducible builds](https://reproducible-builds.org/).

title: pypo fails to parse Gettext file with unix newlines on Windows
body: The poparser assumes that the file uses platform native newlines, what can easily be false on Windows when working with Gettext as most of the Gettext files use unix newlines. In this case the resulting pypo is empty.

title: YAML serialization raises an exception when a node disappears
body:
https://github.com/translate/translate/blob/e5d4d38fbcc7fb310683e7b12f9ae7deab9d7788/translate/storage/yaml.py#L142

```Exception Value:	'str' object does not support item assignment```

In my case (through weblate), the existing file has:
```
it:
  base:
    path: Italian path
```

And a new node is used in the source translation (`base->path->sublevel`):
```
en:
  base:
    path:
      sublevel: Now I want these nested actually
```

The code in `serialize` will raise an exception on line 154 (and make the file empty).

title: Fix JSON tests
body:
Fixes wrongly used base class in JSON tests and resulting test failures.

I've just spotted this bug in code as I've made same mistake in #3500 and the same problem is in resx (see #3504).

title: PO duplicates handling caused regressions
body:
As reported by @friedelwolff:

> https://github.com/translate/translate/commit/9ec2eb89445891984979d96bb59317eba430be96#commitcomment-16661113
> This broke Virtaal, and the performance of PO parsing regressed quite a bit (might be because of this). Sorry that I'm not able to look into it.

As suggestions on doing this properly were:
- Move handling of duplicates to converters to prevent them outputting PO files with duplicates, and
- Alter PO `parse` to deal with duplicates in a different way than now either:
  - Pick only the first and warn about a duplicate being found, or
  - Throw an error and abort parsing like gettext tools do (perhaps this is the preferred choice).

Independently on the choice chosen performance tests are required to ensure we didn't regress too much in reference to version 1.13.0.

Note this handling was introduced to fix https://github.com/translate/pootle/issues/3564

title: optrecurse errors when writing back to the same file
body:
``` pytb
$ pot2po --errorlevel=traceback -t af templates af
pot2po: WARNING: writing to temporary output... 9%
pot2po: WARNING: Error processing: input templates/browser/chrome/overrides/appstrings.properties.pot, output af/browser/chrome/overrides/appstrings.properties.po, template af/browser/chrome/overrides/appstrings.properties.po: Traceback (most recent call last):

    fulloutputpath)

  File "/Users/dwayne/dev/toolkit/translate/misc/optrecurse.py", line 535, in finalizetempoutputfile
    outputfile.reset()

AttributeError: '_io.BytesIO' object has no attribute 'reset'
```

This error also occurs with

``` console
pot2po --errorlevel=traceback -t af/browser/chrome/browser/browser.dtd.po templates/browser/chrome/browser/browser.dtd.pot af/browser/chrome/browser/browser.dtd.po 
pomerge --mergecomments=no --errorlevel=traceback -t cy cy-fuzzy cy
```

title: UnicodeEncodeError when running quality check filters
body:
Just switched my local virtualenv from 1.13 to master (1.14rc1), and I can constantly reproduce the following traceback when running quality checks in Pootle (via submissions):

``` pytb
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "~/.virtualenvs/pootle/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 132, in get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "~/dev/translate/pootle/pootle/apps/pootle_misc/util.py", line 58, in wrapper
    return f(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "~/dev/translate/pootle/pootle/apps/pootle_store/decorators.py", line 61, in decorated_f
    return f(request, unit, *args, **kwargs)
  File "~/dev/translate/pootle/pootle/apps/pootle_store/views.py", line 594, in submit
    form.save()
  File "~/.virtualenvs/pootle/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/models.py", line 459, in save
    construct=False)
  File "~/.virtualenvs/pootle/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/forms/models.py", line 105, in save_instance
    instance.save()
  File "~/dev/translate/pootle/pootle/apps/pootle_store/models.py", line 532, in save
    self.update_qualitychecks()
  File "~/dev/translate/pootle/pootle/apps/pootle_store/models.py", line 847, in update_qualitychecks
    qc_failures = checker.run_filters(self, categorised=True)
  File "~/dev/translate/translate/translate/filters/checks.py", line 534, in run_filters
    return super(TranslationChecker, self).run_filters(unit, categorised)
  File "~/dev/translate/translate/translate/filters/checks.py", line 455, in run_filters
    (functionname, unit.source, unit.target, e))
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 27-35: ordinal not in range(128)
```

Switching back to 1.13 makes things work again.

title: [html2po] <pre> code block snippets normalization problem
body:
Version: trunk `
` multi-line code block is should not be normalization.
### `
` example:

``` html

// JavaScript's most important data type is the object.
// An object is a collection of name/value pairs, or a string to value map.
var book = {               // Objects are enclosed in curly braces.
    topic: "JavaScript",   // The property "topic" has value "JavaScript".
    fat: true              // The property "fat" has value true.
};                         // The curly brace marks the end of the object.

```
### Expect Results:

```
msgid "// JavaScript's most important data type is the object."
msgstr ""

msgid "// An object is a collection of name/value pairs, or a string to value map."
msgstr ""

msgid "var book = {               // Objects are enclosed in curly braces."
msgstr ""

msgid "    topic: "JavaScript",   // The property "topic" has value "JavaScript"."
msgstr ""

msgid "    fat: true              // The property "fat" has value true."
msgstr ""

msgid "};                         // The curly brace marks the end of the object."
msgstr ""
```
### html2po Results:

```
#: ch01.html+html.body.div.div.pre:119
msgid ""
"// JavaScript's most important data type is the object. // An object is a "
"collection of name/value pairs, or a string to value map. var book = { // "
"Objects are enclosed in curly braces. topic: \"JavaScript\", // The property "
"\"topic\" has value \"JavaScript\". fat: true // The property \"fat\" has "
"value true. }; // The curly brace marks the end of the object."
msgstr ""
```

title: Get back translate/misc/profiling.py
body:
This is used in amaGama https://github.com/translate/amagama/blob/0eb40629/amagama/commands.py#L127

Commit that removed that code: https://github.com/translate/translate/commit/a513bb27.
